intro: Ecbolium simplex, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a herbaceous plant native to certain regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its simple, alternate leaves are usually lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Ecbolium simplex produces small, inconspicuous flowers clustered in a cyathium, a characteristic structure of the spurge family.
